content.p: This page contain some information about ways you can contribute to the Heimdal project. See also the source code page for change logs and source repository information.
The documentation to the Heimdal is quite good, but we can get better. If you have any suggestions, don't hesitate to submit text/comments via GitHub's Heimdal Issues page.

This one is simple, if you find something, don't assume its already fixed, send us a short mail about it. If you do, you might get a patch back it the problem is already found, or help you'll help us make Heimdal even better.
You submit the bugs via <a href="https://github.com/heimdal/heimdal/issues/>GitHub's Heimdal Issues page.
content.h3: Adding tests to the regression suite
content.p: When you have a bug, think (and ask us) if its possible to do automated checking if that what now is broken works. This way you'll make sure the bug is not reintroduced again when its fixed. It's boring to report broken functionallity over and over again, so if you help us with this you don't have to.
If you think this sounds like Reporting bugs is because its the next step after fixing a bug. Making sure we never see it again.
You submit the new tests and questions via <a href="https://github.com/heimdal/heimdal/issues/>GitHub's Heimdal Issues page.
Buildbot allows automated testing of Heimdal. If you can contribute cpu resources, or os installation that run ON i386 in vmware to build please let us know.

Software that needs to be installed:
yacc/byacc/bison
lex/flex
automake
autoconf
libtool
makeinfo
unzip
buildbot
Thank you for making Heimdal better.
